channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2023120278
item.description:
Report E-2023120278

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: CARTHAGE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 06, 2023, at 2020 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Carthage, Texas regarding the release of approximately (15) gallons of UN 2873, Dibutylaminoethanol, 6.1, PG III from a (1) 55-gallon DM that was punctured caused by a load shift. Contractors confirmed the release was contained to a 10’ x 8’ area on the trailer floor, a 4’ x 4’ area of concrete under the trailer, and a 90’ x 3’ area of concrete at a fuel island. The release was cleaned using bleach and absorbents while wearing the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (3) 55-gallon DM’s and 1 supersack, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023120329
item.description:
Report X-2023120329

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A member of our hazmat team noticed that the package was wet. He then proceeded to place package in a damaged hazmat tote. Afterwards the package was brought to the damaged hazmat area. DescribePack: Loose closures are what led to the package leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a damaged hazmat tote, to prevent the spread of damage to other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023120326
item.description:
Report X-2023120326

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120326 SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE OF EVENTS UNKNOWN. AT TIME OF DISCOVERY, PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE. AT THAT TIME THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN HAZBAG AND PLACED IN HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: TWO OF THE FOUR CANS WERE DENTED AND CONTENTS LEAKED OUT OF PENCIL-TIP SIZED HOLE WHERE THE METAL WAS BENT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: METAL JERRICANS WERE UP-RIGHTED BECAUSE THE CONTENTS HAD ALREADY LEAKED OUT BEYOND WHERE THE DAMAGED HOLE WAS LOCATED, WHICH WAS TOWARD THE TOP PART OF THE CONTAINER. 2. X-2023120330 SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE OF EVENTS UNKNOWN. AT TIME OF DISCOVERY, PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE. AT THAT TIME THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN HAZBAG AND PLACED IN HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: TWO OF THE FOUR CANS WERE DENTED AND CONTENTS LEAKED OUT OF HOLE WHERE THE METAL WAS BENT ON ONE OF THE CONTAINERS AND FROM THE LOOSENED CAP ON THE OTHER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BECAUSE THE CONTENTS HAD ALREADY LEAKED OUT BEYOND WHERE THE DAMAGED HOLE WAS LOCATED, THE METAL CANS WERE UP-RIGHTED TO PREVENT ANY FURTHER LEAKING.

item.title: Report X-2023120322
item.description:
Report X-2023120322

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler noticed that the External packaging was wet. Said package handler notified their manager, who placed the package in a damaged hazmat tote. Afterward it was taken to the damages area where a team member pointed the package out to our hazmat certified admin. The package was then brought to our damaged hazmat, processing area. DescribePack: Loose caps and damaged seams at the top of 2 bottles led to the package leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a damaged hazmat tote. It was then separated from other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023120312
item.description:
Report X-2023120312

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found with wet corners on rollers near a load door. A small spill was found under the rollers. When moved to Hazmat area, bottom of box tore off, causing one bottle with no cap to fall and spill. DescribePack: When all four bottles were placed into salvage drum, it was noticed that 2 caps had come off and the 2 bottles were half empty, including the one that fell over. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Neutralizer and absorbent pads were used. Box was removed immediately from loading area.

item.title: Report E-2023120223
item.description:
Report E-2023120223

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-20T18:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: LUBBOCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLB experienced a NA1993 CORR21334A release from a 230-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of material released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock due to a bad valve. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents and PPE into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

All 3 felt half empty. 4 one gallon bottles were indicated on box label. Three are indicated in system on FTrack. 3 were present with the box in the drum. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box and bottles were contained in a salvage drum when found.

item.description:

  • City: FORT WORTH

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet and torn inside of a Hazmat bag inside of the Hazmat cage. Original shipping label was not visible. Tracking number identified on OP-900 label. DescribePack: 4 one gallon bottles were indicated on box. 3 were present. All were wet. One was missing its cap and dented. Another was leaking from a puncture hole on the bottom. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading since package was contained in Hazmat bag. Bottles were placed into a salvage drum during inspection.

The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup thew release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023120133
item.description:
Report E-2023120133

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a UN1866 ELAN-Cast P 300 S RTC Low Odor release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of material released to the entire trailer floor as well as a 30’ x 20’ area of the concrete lot below due to the trailer wall puncturing the tote. The puncture was patched with wood to stop the release and the material was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. The free-standing liquid material was collected with a drum vac into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. Floor dry was then deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into a third 55-gallon metal drum. The punctured tote was patched with absorbent pads & chemical tape. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023120039
item.description:
Report I-2023120039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: Laredo
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX TRADE NETWORKS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ALR Trucking arrived at the FedEx Trade Networks facility carrying cargo from Mexico destined for sortation and subsequent distribution in the U.S. Upon opening the trailer doors, it was discovered that one drum of UN1263 was Ieaking near the chime. Six(6) drums were loaded on one wooden skid(pallet) and were secured with plastic and metal banding and shrink-wrap. There were damaged boards on the loading side of the skid. The drum that was Ieaking had its chime fall between the boards, either during the banding process or during transportation. The constant friction of transportation caused the chime area to buckle into the bottom of the drum. The drums are not UN Specification as required in the regulations. We contacted our emergency spill clean-up vendor. They placed the 7 gallon drum into a larger overpack containment drum. The materials used to clean up the small amount that spilled were placed into a 5-gallon plastic bucket for waste disposal. Please see the accompanying photographs of the load upon arrival and the subsequent mitigation. While we do no have the final figures on the remediation, we believe the cost of the clean-up crew to average around $500 or more, and the disposal of the clean-up material to start at$250.

  • City: LAREDO

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 29, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN2966 released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the dock floor due to faulty packaging. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel utilized absorbent pads and Simple Green to wipe down the impacted dock floor and other pails of product. All spent absorbent pads, PPE, and any miscellaneous cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 5-gallon pail. The two (2) damaged pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon steel drum and staged onsite for disposal.

  • Description: Waste material was staged onto a pallet with other materials then loaded onto an lngenium truck at the Wastelinq transfer facility, then routed to NSSI for disposal. Upon arrival, operations opened the trailer and found drums that had toppled over while in transit. The container in question had a loose lid and a few ounces of material had spilled onto the floor of the truck. NSSI operations acted immediately and unloaded the truck and placed absorbent on the spill. The used absorbent was removed and drummed for disposal. No signs of spillage beyond the trailer were observed.

  • Description: At approximately 0815 on 09/21/23, we observed product leaking from the top of the car, and down the sides, we immediately engaged our Hazardous Materials contractor to address the situation, perform necessary repairs, and carry out remediation efforts. Upon inspection, Haz-Mat Special Services identified the source of the leak to be the liquid leg line valve mounting flange, which connects to the manway cover plate was not seated correctly, HMSS was able to secure the flange and prevent any further product leakage.
